END-USER LICENSE AGREEMENT AND PRIVACY POLICY
This End-User License Agreement ("EULA") is a legal agreement between you and General Solutions and Services, LLC. By installing, copying, or otherwise using the SOFTWARE PRODUCT, you agree to be bound by the terms of this EULA. This license agreement represents the entire agreement concerning the program between you and General Solutions and Services, LLC (referred to as "licenser"). If you do not agree to the terms of this EULA, do not install or use the SOFTWARE PRODUCT.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
We do not ask for any personal information from children.

1. Disclaimer of Warranty

Licenser expressly disclaims any warranty for the SOFTWARE PRODUCT. The SOFTWARE PRODUCT is provided 'As Is' without any express or implied warranty of any kind, including but not limited to any warranties of merchantability, noninfringement, or fitness of a particular purpose. By using this software you acknowledge that you have read the application description in marketplace including permission explanations, and use it entirely at your own risk. 

2. Limitation of Liability

In no event shall licenser be liable for any damages (including, without limitation, lost profits, business interruption, or lost information) rising out of 'Authorized Users' use of or inability to use the SOFTWARE PRODUCT.


3. Privacy Policy
General Solutions and Services, LLC is 100 % committed to safeguarding your privacy. Please feel free to contact us immediately if you have any questions or you notice something that needs our attention by emailing us at support@kiddoware.com
Please note that this app does not ask for any personal information from children.
i. The Information We Collect
"Personally Identifiable Information" (PII) is information that can be linked to a person or persistently linked to a mobile device. We do NOT an PII in this app.
"Non Personally Identifiable Information" (Non-PII) is information such as the type of operating system and build that you use. Non-PII is used to help troubleshoot any user issues.
We collect the following non-PII:
Device Manufacturer; model; build information; applications errors for analytics and troubleshooting purpose.
We also use a third party, Google Analytics library, to anonymously collect the data regarding various actions user takes within our apps. This is used to figure out what features are being used and how often to help us improve our apps. We may also receive users email address when a user submits a form through the "Contact Us" activity of the app so that we may respond to the question or feedback. We collect the email address for the sole purpose of responding directly on a one-time basis to a specific user request. If the user does not wish to authorize the collection of the information mentioned above then the user should not accept this agreement. Similarly, if a user wants to prevent collection of data, then they may simply uninstall the app or stop using it.
ii. How We Use, Disclose, and Store the Information We Collect
In addition to the purposes described in Section 1, we may use information to analyze usage, to improve current and future product offerings.
Regardless of the type of data that is collected, we will never share your data with any third parties. We may disclose information where we are required to do so by law, for example, in response to a court order or a subpoena, or where we disclose information to service providers or other group companies who provide support for the operations of our website and application and who do not use or disclose the information for any other purpose. To the extent permitted by applicable law, we also may disclose information in response to a law enforcement agency's or other public agency's request or if we feel that such disclosure may prevent the instigation of a crime, facilitate an investigation related to public safety, protect the safety of a child, protect the security or integrity of our website, or enable us to take precautions against liability.
If we sell all or part of our business or make a sale or transfer of our assets or are otherwise involved in a merger or business transfer, we may transfer information to a third party as part of that transaction, to the extent permitted by applicable law.
Finally, we may transfer information and store it outside of the jurisdiction in which a user is located.
iii. Security
The security of your information is very important to us. Only authorized person can have access to information we collect.
iv. Access to Information, and Objection to Information Collection and Retention
If you have questions or wish to send us comments about this Privacy Policy, please send an e-mail with your questions or comments to support@Kiddoware.com
